title: Michael's Last Dundies
description: Michael hosts his final "Dundies" as the boss at the Scranton branch, but tension is in the air, and Deangelo Vickers, the new boss, is having trouble with his co-hosting duties.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: It is six a.m. [DeAngelo yawns] and we are about to go house to house to give everyone their Dundie Nomination Certificates. Just like the Oscars!

quotes.speaker: DeAngelo
quotes.text: Yes, and this happens every...?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Every year! This happens, you have a lot to learn my friend. [DeAngelo laughs]

quotes.speaker: DeAngelo
quotes.text: Well, you know, why don't we try it, and if it goes good it'll be part of my tradition.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Why do you always say that? You're gonna love it.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: [arriving at the first house] Alright let's go! [DeAngelo runs in the wrong direction] This way, this way! [Michael knocks on the door]

quotes.speaker: DeAngelo
quotes.text: Thanks.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Surprise!

quotes.speaker: DeAngelo
quotes.text: Congratulations!

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Yep, okay...

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: You and Pam have both been nominated for Dundie Awards!

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Okay.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: [holds up a camera and DeAngelo meows] Here we go! Have Pam come down.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: No she doesn't wa- She's not here.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: What's going on?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Stay in bed!

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: [next house] Congratulations!

quotes.speaker: Stanley
quotes.text: Have you lost your mind! Get off my property before I call the police!

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: We got it.

quotes.speaker: DeAngelo
quotes.text: Uh, leave it at the door or...?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Yeah that's fine.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: [next house] Hey Toby! You suck! [throwing eggs at his house]

quotes.speaker: DeAngelo
quotes.text: Is this an employee of ours?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: [giggles] Go go go go go go!

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: [arriving at a dumpy looking, unkempt house] I've never seen this place in the daylight.

quotes.speaker: DeAngelo
quotes.text: It reminds me of Katrina.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Here we go, alright got it? Set? [the door is ajar, Michael knocks lightly] Hello? [turns around to see Meredith walking towards her house]

quotes.speaker: Meredith
quotes.text: I'm so busted! Walk of shame!

quotes.speaker: DeAngelo
quotes.text: Do you usually leave your door unlocked? And ajar?

quotes.speaker: Meredith
quotes.text: Ahh, Nice! I got a Dundie nomination!

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Yes you did. That's right! Congratulations Meredith. We should head out.

quotes.speaker: Meredith
quotes.text: No no no! You guys stay! No no no! I have Vienna Sausages and I have napkins. [walks into her house] Let me fix you breakfast!

quotes.speaker: DeAngelo
quotes.text: [whispers] I'm not going in there.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: [quietly shuts the door] Go.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: [walking into the office] Good morning Erin.

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: Oh hey, didn't see you.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: You have big plans for tonight?

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: I don't know, maybe volunteer at the shelter, or go to bed, or... I don't know. Maybe I'm going to the Dundies!! [Flashes her Nomination Certificate]

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: You are getting so funny! [Erin giggles] Very good.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: The Dundies are my baby, and they need to go on. When Larry King died they didn't just cancel his show. They got Pierce Morgan to come in, and do his show, and, that way, Larry lives on.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Anything can happen at the Dundies! [DeAngelo laughs] They're like the Golden Globes but less mean. And I just want all of us to have a good time!

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Just a little announcement folks, remember, the Dundies is a black tie affair.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Black tie optional.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Every day is black tie optional!

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: A la, tonight we will be hosting at Louie Volpies!

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: Nice! [rest of the office looks excited]

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.text: I love their breadsticks!

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Oh, their breadsticks are like crack!

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: I love when people say like crack when they've obviously never done crack.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Well the breadsticks are like what then, Ryan, what can I use?

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: I don't know, something from your world. The breadsticks are like scrapbooking.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: You're right, you're right. I'm a middle class broad. [Jim does his "Jim face"]

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Shh, shh! Okay, okay. Everybody's right. They're like breadsticks on steroids. Right?

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: Yeah that's great.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: So as you know, the Dundies are my legacy. So I'm going to need to train a replacement. So this year, I have decided to have a co-host. [Dwight looks suspecting] And that person is [he and DeAngelo roll their tongues as a drum roll] DeAngelo! [all applaud]

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Always the padawan, never the Jedi.

quotes.speaker: DeAngelo
quotes.text: Thank you Michael, uh, but I will have to pass.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Think of it as part of your training.

quotes.speaker: DeAngelo
quotes.text: Not much of a performer, unless you count singing in the shower. Boy, okay...

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: [smiling] Okay, well we'll work on it.

quotes.speaker: DeAngelo
quotes.text: [whispers to Michael] Michael, I'm very, very bad.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: You are doing it.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: [all in conference room] Guys! I want you to help us work on some banter.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: Yes! I love banter. But I hate witty banter.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Here we go! So, DeAngelo! You and I have a lot in common. You lost two hundred pounds, and I lose my car keys every morning.

quotes.speaker: DeAngelo
quotes.text: That is true, we do share some similarities. I know how you can fix one of those problems, for me it was portion control. For you, you need a key chain. Maybe one with a-

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: [cutting him off] Okay, okay. You know what, I didn't actually lose my keys...

quotes.speaker: DeAngelo
quotes.text: This did not happen.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Mmmmkay. There needs to be what you call a rat-a-tat. And right now it's all rat and no tat. Ryan come on up here. Tap DeAngelo out. Just watch this. Okay. [Ryan stands next to Michael up front] Ryan how are you today?

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: Why don't you ask my therapist, my mom certainly pays her enough.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: [very excited] There you go! Lovely! Regis and Kelly! Nice! Use that as an inspiration.  Just be funny.

quotes.speaker: DeAngelo
quotes.text: Uhhh, you sir! [points to Jim] Are we having fun tonight?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Having a great time.

quotes.speaker: DeAngelo
quotes.text: Oh good!

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Thanks, yeah.

quotes.speaker: DeAngelo
quotes.text: Where were you on September 11th?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: No! God! [Jim looks at him oddly]

quotes.speaker: DeAngelo
quotes.text: This is so weird! If I'm conducting a meeting, good to go. But if I think of it as a performance... I-I fall apart. Obviously.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Why don't you think of hosting the Dundies like you're just running a meeting.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: No, no, no! This is the performance of your life!

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Why don't you just, privately, in your own head, think of it like a meeting.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Jim, please no loopholes.

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: Mike, why do you have to control how he perceives it in his mind?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: This is my last Dundies ever, if I want mind control over him, is that too much to ask?

quotes.speaker: DeAngelo
quotes.text: [laying down, Michael is sitting on DeAngelo's stomach bouncing up and down in Michael's office] Me mo. Me mo.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Good. Good. Good!

quotes.speaker: DeAngelo
quotes.text: Meee Mo, Mee!

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Now, tell me something terrible that happened in your childhood.

quotes.speaker: DeAngelo
quotes.text: When I was very young, my mother divorced my father and I had to go to court and choose between them.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: [getting off his stomach] Too personal. I don't wanna hear about it. [picking up a portable tape player] Let's try this. Put these on. [DeAngelo puts the headphones in] I am going to turn this on, and turn the volume all the way up. So you can't- [DeAngelo winces] That's right, you're not going to be able to hear yourself. Read this, [gives him a card] and make it sound perfect.

quotes.speaker: DeAngelo
quotes.text: THE DUNDIES ARE-OW-ABOUT COMING TOGETHER! AND RECOGNIZING, THE ADOMINABILITY OF THE HUMAN SPIRIT! [Jim comes and closes the door]

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Say it with an accent!

quotes.speaker: DeAngelo
quotes.text: [bad Australian accent attempt] THE DUNDIES!

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: [also in a poor Australian accent] The Dundies!

quotes.speaker: DeAngelo
quotes.text: THE DUNDIES!

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: [Jim and Pam are walking outside] I just don't understand the desire to push sweet potato fries on me, and not just regular fries.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Yeah... [they see Erin eating in her car, and ducking when they see her. Pam knocks on her car window] Hey, Erin, everything okay?

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: Get away from the car, he's gonna see you.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Who's gonna see us?

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: [desperately] Just get in! Get in! Just get in!

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Get in the car? [Jim and Pam get in the back seat]

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: Please! Sorry. Get in. [Jim and Pam are confused and worried] Sorry sorry sorry.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: What's wrong?

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: I eat lunch in the car now.  It's my alone time. It's just nice to have some time away from Gabe.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Why don't you wanna eat lunch with your boyfriend?

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: I, really don't like spending time with him.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Don't you think it's better to tell him the truth now? You know, rather than waste more of his time?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: I think I'm gonna go.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: What?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: I think you got this. Kay? [Erin nods] Alright. Feel better!

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: Thank you Jim.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: I'm sorry, that just wasn't interesting to me.

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: I can't just dump him Pam, I'm not like you, I can't be mean.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Wait, when am I...? You just have to be clear and firm. You know, just tell him you don't love him. Just be honest with him. [Erin nods]

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: [standing by the Louie Volpies entrance greeting people and giving them menus]

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: [walks in] Hi!

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Appalling. [Meredith walks in] Eye sore. [Jim and Pam come in] Surprisingly adequate! Okay everyone! The activities commence in four seconds!

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: DeAngelo, Jo's on the phone for you.

quotes.speaker: DeAngelo
quotes.text: Hello?

quotes.speaker: Jo
quotes.text: [Michael dressed as Jo Bennett, using a bad Southern accent] DeAngelo! We're in serious horse manure here! The Dundies are tonight! And we ain't got no host!

quotes.speaker: DeAngelo
quotes.text: Oh no!

quotes.speaker: Jo
quotes.text: Luckily I have someone for you!

quotes.speaker: DeAngelo
quotes.text: Billy Crystal?

quotes.speaker: Jo
quotes.text: Better.

quotes.speaker: DeAngelo
quotes.text: Neil Patrick Harris?

quotes.speaker: Jo
quotes.text: He's in Little Shop of Horrors on Broadway. Now we need Michael Scott! The best darn Dundies host on both sides of the Mississippi! [everyone in the audience is laughing]

quotes.speaker: DeAngelo
quotes.text: Ughhh, I gotta find Michael Scott! And then I gotta, [Russel Brand impression] Get Him to the Dundies!

quotes.speaker: DeAngelo
quotes.text: [in the office near the accountants] Hey, can you help me find Michael Scott Angela?

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: [Michael is wearing a blond wig, talking in a high obnoxious voice] My boyfriend can, he's a state senator.

quotes.speaker: Audience
quotes.text: [laughing]

quotes.speaker: DeAngelo
quotes.text: Mmhmm.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: Oh wait, he can't help because that title has no meaning!

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: [laughing]

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: Try Jim DeAngelo, he'll be able to help.

quotes.speaker: DeAngelo
quotes.text: Jim! Do you know where I can find Michael Scott?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: [Michael is wearing a wig that is very close to Jim's actual hair, and he is wearing fake earrings, and speaking in a punk-ish deep voice] I totally don't know where Michael is, dude, hey you wanna listen to some records?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: [shaking head at the camera]

quotes.speaker: DeAngelo
quotes.text: No one is listening to me! And I'm running out of time!

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.text: [Micheal dressed as Phyllis, pretending to knit] Well, what are you talking about? [cracking noise] Ohh! Ohh! [falls onto the ground] I've fallen and I can't get up!

quotes.speaker: DeAngelo
quotes.text: Maybe I just need to look into my heart. [in the bathroom in front of the mirror] DeAngelo, where is Michael Scott. [his reflection in the mirror turns around to reveal that it is Michael]

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I'm here. [DeAngelo gasps and turns around] In a good way! I've been here the whole time.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: The analytical part of me wants to examine it, but I know it has no content.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Ladies and gentlemen, please stand up for you co-host this evening, Michael Gary Scott. [Michael comes running up to stage as people applaud] Please remain standing for your other co-host, and new manager, DeAngelo Jeremitrius Vickers! [DeAngelo presents himself, and changes his mind and runs off] Was that part of the...?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: [in the bathroom] DeAngelo, what are you doing? There's a live audience out there!

quotes.speaker: DeAngelo
quotes.text: Go do it by yourself, get Ryan.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: No, Ryan would never do it. It's too on the radar. Look, look. The boss, hosts, the Dundies! It's sort of our perk!

quotes.speaker: DeAngelo
quotes.text: This was not, part of the job description!

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Listen to me, you're not doing this for me, you're not doing this for you, you're not even doing this for them!

quotes.speaker: DeAngelo
quotes.text: Who am I doing this for?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: [slaps him] You're doing this for all those kids out there, eating off the Louie Volpies kid's menu, wondering: Does it get better? What I want you to do, is I want you to say: It's showtime. Get out there.

quotes.speaker: DeAngelo
quotes.text: I can't. [Michael slaps him again]

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Say it.

quotes.speaker: DeAngelo
quotes.text: Stop, hitting me.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: You can do it, just say it.

quotes.speaker: DeAngelo
quotes.text: Hit me again. [Michael slaps him once more]

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Now hit me. [DeAngelo slaps him] One, two, three.

quotes.speaker: Together
quotes.text: It's showtime.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Alright, here we go.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Okay! Okay! Sorry about the delay everybody! But we were at the DMV waiting in line. [everyone laughs]

quotes.speaker: DeAngelo
quotes.text: Fall asleep right after sex. Huh guys?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Nope, go back to the script.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: There are a lot of great salesmen in this office, but one of our great salesmen is also a great dad. And a close personal friend of mine, Jim Halpert! Best Dad Dundie! [Dwight plays a celebratory honking noise on his keyboard]

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Wow! I do not parent for the award but I gotta tell you It feels pretty good. Uh, Cece, if you're watching this at home it's way past your bedtime, by the way how'd this get televised?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Well done.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: I don't know maybe being a good dad is just all in your own compass. I don't know, I don't know. Thank you!

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Alright. [all applaud Jim]

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: You didn't think to mention me huh?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Didn't I?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Which moves us to, Best Mom Dundie. [Pam gets ready and Jim smiles at her] I guess we all kinda consider her a mom around the office. Meredith Palmer!

quotes.speaker: Meredith
quotes.text: [jogs up and makes out with Michael, who is unwilling] Tell ya one thing, I'm not gonna be a good mom tonight! Whooo!

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Excuse me, can I get a photo of the Best Mom and the Best Dad please?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: I gotta go do this.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: [annoyed] Why?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Big smiles folks! There they are.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Year after year, I catch a lot of flak on this particular award, because year after year I present this award to a guy instead of a girl. Hottest in the office goes to, [Ryan stands up] Danny Cordray! [Ryan quickly sits] Danny couldn't be here tonight...

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: How do I feel about not winning Hottest in the Office this year? Uhm, I'm very relieved. How do you, how do you judge something like that? What is the criteria even? It's, it's so subjective.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Stanley Hudson is a grump, everybody knows that. [Stanley looks angry] But did you know, that Stanley Hudson is also the face of a debilitating disease known as diabetes. The Diabetes Award goes to Stanley Hudson! [Stanley slowly walks over, angry] Come on up here you sick bastard.

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.text: I have diabetes too. You don't see me making a big deal about it.

quotes.speaker: DeAngelo
quotes.text: They say he's going to be my right hand man, adlib masturbation joke. [realizing he wasn't supposed to read that directly off the cue card, speaks quietly] No, I hate this, I hate it so much. [loud again] Dwight Schrute! Please accept this promising Assistant Manager Dundie. [people clap as Dwight takes the microphone, he is obviously unenthused] Thank you, thank you so much. I would like to thank something that we, uh, take for granted in our daily lives. And that is the humble trashcan. [Creed nods] This is for you trashcan! [walks off and throws the Dundie into the trashcan]

quotes.speaker: Manager
quotes.text: [the manager of Louie Volpies approaches a giggling Kevin, who is coloring with crayons on the tablecloth] Who gave you those crayons?

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: I brought them from home! Do you have a red?

quotes.speaker: Manager
quotes.text: This is a cloth tablecloth! You can't color on it!

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: Oh really? [camera shows that Kevin has drawn a house on the tablecloth.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: You know, herpes affects one in five sexually active adults? [manager looks up, angrily at Michael] Pippy Longstocking, Ronald McDonald's wife, Ron Howard, Ron Weasley, what do thay all have in common? Red heads. Erin Hannon, come on up here and receive your Cutest Red Head in the Office Award! [Erin looks thrilled and walks up to the stage]

quotes.speaker: Meredith
quotes.text: That is bull! [throws her Dundie]

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: Thank you, thank you! This is the first award I've ever won in my entire life. [Gabe and Andy smile at her] People are right about the Dundies, they are magical. But, I don't feel it. And I think that's because I'm not with the right person. Gabe, we should break up.

quotes.speaker: Gabe
quotes.text: What?

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: I'm not attracted to you. I just, I cringe when you talk. I have to be honest. Right, right Pam? [Pam looks very awkward] Thank you for hearing me.

quotes.speaker: Gabe
quotes.text: [stands up and walks to stage, takes the microphone] Well, this is embarrassing, um, I'm obviously really angry at Erin. It's that quarter life crisis everyone's been talking about. [Jim is looking wide eyed, jaw dropped] Alright I'm gonna go. [Dwight plays cricket noises]

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: [escorts Erin off stage] There you go.

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: Damn that was cold.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: It is difficult to recognize the person who will be replacing you. But he is a good guy, so the Michael Scott Award for Best Dundies Host goes to DeAngelo Vickers. [DeAngelo jogs up and takes the Dundie and tries to go back to his seat]

quotes.speaker: Audience
quotes.text: Speech! Speech! Speech! Speech!

quotes.speaker: DeAngelo
quotes.text: Hold on, hold on one second. [puts on the headphones and turns the volume up all the way] I WANNA, I WANNA, I FEEL TRULY BLESSED! UHHH, TO BE WORKING WITH ALL OF YOU! BEFORE THIS ALL STARTED, FUNNY STORY, I WAS IN THE BATHROOM, VOMITTING, AND VOMITTING IN THE MEN'S ROOM!

quotes.speaker: Manager
quotes.text: Okay, okay. [trying to stop him from offending other people in his restaurant]

quotes.speaker: DeAngelo
quotes.text: THAT'S WHY IT'S BEEN SHUT DOWN FOR MOST OF THE EVENING...

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: [stopping Manager] DeAngelo is expressing himself. [manager pulls the microphone cable, everyone can still here DeAngelo.

quotes.speaker: DeAngelo
quotes.text: This is truly special, for me! And uh, anyway. It's so much lighter!

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Okay, we're done! That's it.

quotes.speaker: DeAngelo
quotes.text: Michael, are we?!

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: We're done. We're done!

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: [Outside of the restaurant, obviously sad] So that is how it ends. My last Dundies ever. I was hoping it'd be more like Godfather Three. That rapped up the whole franchise in an extremely satisfying way. But instead it is like Godfather One! That was, very confusing, had maybe three big laughs. Oh well...

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Michael, we were thinking maybe we could keep this thing going!

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: What?

quotes.speaker: DeAngelo
quotes.text: I know I'm the cause of this royal screw up but I would like to see this show go on.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: No, no. You're being too hard on yourself. We had a very truncated rehearsal time.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Let's grab some ice cream, go back to the office, and finish what we started. [others nod in agreement]

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: So what you're saying is you kinda like it? [Phyllis impression] I've fallen and I can't get up! [normal again] That Phyllis bit, that was pretty good.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: I don't know that we need to dissect it all now, but-

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: That got a big laugh.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: That did. Pretty huge laugh.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: [to Stanley, who is cracking up again] You were laughing right?

quotes.speaker: Stanley
quotes.text: I was.

quotes.speaker: DeAngelo
quotes.text: [with Dwight and Michael outside Michael's car] You know what, I have to go to the bathroom.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: We're really close.

quotes.speaker: DeAngelo
quotes.text: I can just run over to the gas station.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: We should just wait here and not get good seats in the conference room?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: That's true, we wouldn't get seats together.

quotes.speaker: DeAngelo
quotes.text: Okay, fine I'll hold it.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: [in the car] You know, despite a couple hiccups, I think that went very well.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: I thought it was the worst Dundies I've ever been to.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Man! Maybe you should have won the Kind of a Bitch Award.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Gladly! I'd accept that award, because a bitch, is a female dog!

quotes.speaker: DeAngelo
quotes.text: [as Michael pulls over and stops the car] Please don't stop so suddenly, the seatbelt is pressing on my bladder. Why are you even wearing a seatbelt, you're sitting in the backseat, baby.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: What is your problem?!

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: I just don't see a point in the Dundies! Okay? The jokes are terrible, the venue is bad, the fashion is boring.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Okay! That, that is unfair! The clothing was safe, but tasteful.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: And next time, why don't you pick a co-host, that doesn't have microphone-a-phobia!

quotes.speaker: DeAngelo
quotes.text: [very uncomfortable] Look, what ever you're going to do, how long is it going to take? Ballpark. 'Cause I just, I gotta make a decision here. [gets out and slams the door]

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: He is in an all-out sprint.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: [in conference room] Here... [Andy walks in] Okay! By his own omission, this person actually tried marijuana in college, so the Doobie Doobie Pothead Stoner of the Year Award goes to, Andy Bernard! [Andy walks up]

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: A lot of people I'd like to thank, but I think we all actually wanna thank you Michael.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Oh, okay. [nods to him]

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: I mean, we actually all really wanna thank you, for everything.

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: [starts playing the tune to Seasons of Love while Andy sits down]

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Oh my God, something's happening.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: [singing] Nine million, nine hundred eighty six thousand minutes! We actually sat down, and did the math.

quotes.speaker: All
quotes.text: Nine million, nine hundred eighty six thousand minutes! That's how many minutes, that you've worked here.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: In costumes!

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: And impressions!

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.text: In meetings.

quotes.speaker: {Erin} and {Kelly}
quotes.text: And cups of coffee.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: For birthdays!

quotes.speaker: Stanley
quotes.text: More meetings and-

quotes.speaker: Women
quotes.text: E-Mail forms you made us read.

quotes.speaker: All
quotes.text: Nine million, nine hundred eighty six thousand minutes! That's like watching Die Hard, eighty thousand times!

quotes.speaker: Meredith
quotes.text: You hit me with your car!

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: You helped me get off drugs!

quotes.speaker: Creed
quotes.text: I watch you when you sleep.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: I forgive you for kissing me!

quotes.speaker: All
quotes.text: Remember to, call. Call. Remember to, call. Call. Remember to, call. Call.

quotes.speaker: {Kelly} and {Erin}
quotes.text: Call, text or e-mail, or call.

quotes.speaker: DeAngelo
quotes.text: [falsetto] Measure your life in love!

quotes.speaker: All
quotes.text: Remember to call, remember to, call. Remember to call.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: [choked up] Yeah, okay. [pauses, then takes a deep breath] Well this is gonna hurt like a mother[bleep].

quotes.speaker: DeAngelo
quotes.text: [recall to Dundies at Louie Volpies] Every day, millions of Americans suffer from extreme repulsiveness. Someone in our midst, is bringing that problem to light. Toby Flenderson, please come up here and accept the Extreme Repulsiveness Award. Oh that's so mean!

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: No it's not.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: [Toby is shaking his head, no] It's his last Dundies.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: You gotta play along man.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: Come on Toby.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Here he comes! Alright! You deserve it! [Toby comes up and take the mic]

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.text: I really disagree with this. I think it's kind of hateful. Though I am a little happy right now to have a platform to talk about the outcome of a case I was recently a juror on. The Scranton Strangler. That man's being put to death. I was part of the verdict, and I'm not so sure he's guilty any more. [Dwight plays a clip from the song Oh Yeah:
